element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm reduces the effects of sensor differences when comparing images from two dates.
Calibration can be done aplying two different methods: Adjusting the image so it has a given average and standard deviation values, or applying some given gain and offset values.
In the first case, it uses the formula:
NDC = (((ND - average) / standard_deviation) x typical_deviation) + image_average
In the second case, the following formula is used:
NDC = gain x ND + offset

element.name: METHOD
element.text: The following methods are available: * Average and Standard deviation. * Gain and offset
